meanings.definition: At an equal distance from two points.
meanings.sent1: The two trees were equidistant from the park entrance.
meanings.sent2: The equidistant spacing of the houses gave the neighborhood a balanced look.
meanings.sent3: The equidistant placement of the cupcakes on the table made it look like a delicious pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, reaching every corner equidistantly.
meanings.sent5: The equidistant stars in the night sky formed a perfect line above us.

meanings.definition: Equally distant from two or more points.
meanings.sent1: The equidistant markers on the map helped us navigate easily.
meanings.sent2: The equidistant distribution of chairs in the room ensured everyone had a good view.
meanings.sent3: The equidistant placement of the ingredients on the counter made cooking a breeze.
meanings.sent4: His voice carried through the valley, reaching each house equidistantly.
meanings.sent5: The equidistant flags along the path guided us to the finish line.
